description: AI parsing extracts structured fields while keeping the pasted job description mostly unchanged
steps: Paste a job description into the Add Job form
Trigger Parse with AI
Confirm company/title/location/skills populate
Verify the job description retains original wording with only light formatting

description: Apple Intelligence prompt explicitly requests minimal formatting without paraphrasing
steps: Review the SystemLanguageModelService prompt
Confirm instructions forbid paraphrasing
Run a parse and inspect formattedJobDescription output

description: Import parser handles legacy arrays and modern JSON backups with mixed date formats
steps: Import CareerJourney_Backup-12-20-2025.json
Import JobsBackup.json
Verify jobs load without parse errors
Confirm duplicates are skipped

description: Bulk import accepts the BACKUPS folder and routes jobs, notes, and documents appropriately
steps: Choose BACKUPS as the import target
Confirm JSON backups import into Jobs
Confirm notes markdown imports into Notes
Confirm PDF/doc files import into Documents

description: Cross-component comments explain how views, stores, and services fit together
steps: Review comments in CareerJourneyApp, ContentView, and stores
Confirm comments describe data flow between components

description: Jobs can be exported to CSV and re-imported without overwriting existing entries
steps: Export jobs to CSV from the Data menu
Import the CSV back into the app
Verify jobs are created and duplicates are skipped

description: Required skills AI output is concise and limited to relevant tools/domains
steps: Paste a job description into the Add Job form
Trigger Parse with AI
Verify required skills list is limited to a small set of relevant items

description: Add/Edit Job windows use a clean, aligned macOS-native layout with full-width editors
steps: Open Add Job and Edit Job windows
Confirm text editors span full width and have visible borders
Confirm salary fields do not wrap and labels align cleanly

description: Salary inputs support USD/RMB and monthly/yearly selection, storing converted USD/year values
steps: Open Add Job or Edit Job
Select RMB and Monthly, enter min/max salaries
Save and verify salary charts use USD/year values with RMB entries differentiated

description: MapKit geocoding normalizes city names and clusters same-city jobs on maps and location charts
steps: Add jobs with location variants in the same city
Open Stats map and location charts
Confirm entries are combined under a single normalized city

description: Notes and documents can be exported for later re-import
steps: Use the Data menu to export notes to Markdown
Export documents to a folder
Re-import and verify no duplicates are created

description: Stats charts use readable bar sizing and horizontal scroll where needed
steps: Open Statistics
Check company, salary, and location bar charts
Confirm bars are readable and charts scroll horizontally when dense
